column6: | Has a built-in tracker and announcement service
| Uses [[Mono Project|Mono]] or [[.NET Core]] for cross-platform support (.NET)

column4: | {{yes}} (IPv4 and IPv6 have separate binaries and processes that do not share any information between them. If a client communicates to the tracker over IPv6 it will only receive IPv6 addresses in the response.)
column6: | Uses libowfat performs well even on [[embedded hardware]]. Only requirement is a [[POSIX]] compliant [[Operating system|OS]]. Supports only a compact peer list.
| Extremely lightweight and efficient [[BitTorrent (protocol)|BitTorrent]] tracker. Supports [[SQLite3]] and [[MySQL]] for storage.
| Does not have a list of hosted torrents.
| Lightweight. Supports DHT PEX announcements via UDP. Does not have a web interface or list of hosted torrents; it is not designed for secure or large-scale application.
| [[Vuze]] (formerly Azureus) has a built in tracker.
| Uses [[MySQL]] for data storage lightweight tracker
| A lightweight tracker that does not require any external database support.
